incidents.name: Errors on AI features

incident_updates.body: We are witnessing significant recovery in the services. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

We are actively communicating with the affected AI Service provider and closely monitoring the ongoing outage situation. While we have observed some signs of recovery, the majority of API calls are still resulting in errors.

We have successfully restored the Smart Answers in Search feature by rerouting requests to an alternative model.

All other Atlassian Intelligence capabilities and Rovo remain unavailable at this time due to the ongoing AI Service provider outage.

incidents.name: AI features degraded

incident_updates.body: Between 12:13 AM UTC to 01:30 AM UTC, we experienced a degraded experience for AI features in Confluence, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Rovo. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We are investigating an issue with AI features that is impacting all Rovo and Enterprise and Premium Confluence, Jira Service Management and Jira customers. We will provide more details within the next hour.

incidents.name: Jira Loading slow / Inaccessible with 5XX errors

incident_updates.body: Between 09:00 UTC and 09:51 UTC, we experienced degraded performance for some Jira Service Management and Jira customers. The issue has been resolved, and the service is operating normally.
We have taken action to mitigate this issue and we will continue to monitor for the next hour before marking the incident as resolved.
We are investigating cases of degraded performance for some Jira Service Management and Jira Cloud customers in the EMEA region. We will provide more details within the next hour.

incidents.name: Automation match() smart value with regex is not working

incident_updates.body: Between 24/11/2024 09:46 PM UTC to 27/11/2024 5:58PM UTC, we experienced an issue where Automation match() smart values with regex are not working as expected for Confluence, Jira Service Management, and Jira. This issue has now been resolved, and automation rules are functioning as expected.

We have identified an issue with Automation match() smart values with regex that is impacting all Jira products and Confluence Cloud. We have identified the root cause and have stopped it from reoccurring.

incidents.name: Microsoft API Failure Impacting Jira and JSM Email Processing

incident_updates.body:
We are pleased to inform you that the recent issues affecting email processing for Microsoft accounts, which impacted our Jira and JSM Cloud customers, have been successfully resolved.

This resolution follows Microsoft’s reversion of the changes that initially caused the disruption. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we worked closely with Microsoft to address this matter promptly.
Microsoft has identified the root cause of the API failures and provided an update that they are working on a solution. We are now monitoring this closely.

We are investigating an issue with email processing that is impacting some Jira and JSM Cloud customers. Multiple Microsoft APIs are failing, which is causing emails not to be marked as read and creating duplicate tickets, comments, and customer notifications for email requests in JSM, as well as internal notifications in Jira. The impact started at 7:00 UTC. This is a widespread issue on Microsoft's end, and we are currently awaiting their resolution

incidents.name: previews are not available in some cases

incident_updates.body: Between 07:50 UTC to 11:31 UTC, some customers experienced previews of attachments unavailable for Confluence, Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Jira Product Discovery. We have deployed a fix to mitigate the issue and have verified that the services have recovered. The conditions that cause the bug have been addressed and we're actively working on a permanent fix. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We have identified the root cause of the issue of previews not being available for some attachments and mitigated the problem for new uploads and frequently viewed files that were affected by this issue. The rest of the previews are gradually being regenerated. We are now monitoring this closely.

We continue to work on resolving the previews unavailability for Confluence and Jira attachments. We have identified the root cause and expect recovery shortly.

The issue will not be seen (ie., preview will be available) for new attachment uploads.
We are working on remediating the impacted previews.

We are investigating reports of intermittent errors for some Confluence and Jira Cloud customers where attachment previews are not loading. The attachments are available for download. We will provide more details once we identify the root cause.

incident_updates.body: We have identified the root cause of the recent issue affecting Epic panels not loading and have successfully applied a fix. The issue is now resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue and we'll be providing more updates here

incidents.name: Jira migrations including AR plans are getting stuck on JCMA 1.12.10

incident_updates.body: The issues affecting certain tenants have been successfully resolved, and the impact has been fully mitigated at this time.

Our team has identified the root cause and is actively working on a solution. In the meantime, you can proceed with the migration as long as your team doesn't select AR Plans or if you downgrade to JCMA 1.12.09.

We will provide an update as soon as the issue is resolved.

We are investigating reports of migrations getting stuck for Customers who are migrating Jira selecting AR plans via JCMA. All the customers using JCMA 1.12.10 will be affected. We will provide further updates within the next hour.

incidents.name: Automation logs are not accessible and delayed

The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We are investigating cases of degraded performance with the Automation logs for Confluence, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Jira Product Discovery Cloud customers. However, automation rule runs are not impacted. We will provide more details within the next hour.

incidents.name: Automation limits are incorrect for some Cloud customers

incident_updates.body: Between 04/Nov/24 11:30 PM UTC to 05/Nov/24 10:47 AM UTC, we experienced problems with the automation limits for some Cloud customers for Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, and Jira. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
We are investigating issues with incorrectly set automation limits for some customers and will provide updates here soon.

incidents.name: Unified EPIC colors on Jira Software Board and timeline

incident_updates.body: Between 08:00 UTC to 23:00 UTC, we experienced an issue where all epic colours are displaying as purple in timelines and boards for some customer. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
We continue to work on resolving the issue where all epic colours are displaying as purple in timelines and boards. We have identified the root cause and expect full recovery shortly.
We are currently investigating an issue in Jira Cloud where all epic colors are displaying as purple in timelines and boards, and we are working to resolve it as quickly as possible.

incidents.name: Jira Migrations Failing

incident_updates.body:
Between 24th October 2024, 10:54 AM UTC, and 25th October 2024, 6:58 AM UTC, we encountered an issue with Jira Data Residency migration failures.

We have identified and resolved the problem, and the service is now operating normally. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience and understanding.

Jira Migration is currently experiencing issues for some tenants with data residency requirements. Our team has identified the root cause and is actively working on a solution. We will provide an update as soon as the issue is resolved.

components.name: Administration
components.description: Site, project, and user administration

incidents.name: Tenant provisioning and user management actions - degraded performance

incident_updates.body:
Between 2024-10-23, 15:09 UTC and 2024-10-23, 17:06 UTC, we identified an issue that affected tenant provisioning and user management actions at Atlassian Cloud, causing a delay in performing actions related to these two topics.
We have identified the root cause and the issue has been mitigated.

incidents.name: Intermittent 'Too many requests or error' for some Jira customers

incident_updates.body: Between 22-Oct 09:00 AM UTC to 22-Oct 14:18 PM UTC, we experienced intermittent errors for Jira Cloud products. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
We continue to work on resolving the intermittent errors for Jira Cloud products. We have identified the root cause and expect full recovery shortly.
We are investigating reports of intermittent 'Too many requests or errors' messages showing up for some Jira Cloud customers. Once we identify the root cause, we will provide more details.

incidents.name: Some customers can't view boards with multiple projects

incident_updates.body: Between 21-Oct 23:10 UTC and 22-Oct 03:30 UTC, some customers were not able to view boards containing multiple projects. Fix has been performed and the service is now operating normally.
We received reports from some customers where they are not able to view boards containing multiple projects. We have performed the fix and we are now monitoring the situation.

incidents.name: Partial unavailability in AMER region

incident_updates.body: We experienced availability issues limited to a specific instance in AMER, resulting in Jira being temporarily unavailable. The issue began at 18:58 CET and was restored at 19:59 CET. All services are now fully operational

incidents.name: Some admins unable to see some user/group memberships in AdminHub

incident_updates.body: Between 2024-10-18 05:40 UTC-7 to 2024-10-18 08:40 UTC-7, we experienced an outage affecting user/group memberships in AdminHub for Confluence, Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Guard. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We have received reports of intermittent errors for some Cloud customers, specifically admins who are unable to see group memberships in AdminHub. We have identified the root cause and expect recovery shortly.

incidents.name: Some customers can't create team-managed projects

incident_updates.body: Between 2300 14 October to 0200 16 October, we experienced an outage affecting Team Managed Project creation for Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Jira Product Discovery. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

Some customers are getting an error when trying to create team-managed Jira projects (Jira, Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, Jira Product Discovery).
We are currently investigating this and we will continue to share further updates.

incidents.name: Scheduled automation rules are not triggered

incident_updates.body: Between 6 AM UTC to 10 AM UTC on October 7th, we experienced issues with automation rules and scheduled rules for Confluence, Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, and Jira. We have implemented and monitored the fix, and the issue has been resolved. The service is operating normally.

We are observing a recovery on our monitoring dashboards. The affected rules will be executed in the next few hours, if they haven't been processed already. We will keep monitoring the situation during this time before marking the incident as 'Resolved'.

We identified that automation rules running between 6 AM UTC and 10 AM UTC may have been impacted by the incident. Additionally, all scheduled rules during this window were affected. We have taken action to mitigate this issue, and we are currently working on recovery. We know what the fix is and are implementing it now. The affected rules will run once the fix is applied.
We are investigating issues with scheduled automated rules and will provide updates here soon.

incidents.name: Something went wrong on our end

incident_updates.body: Between 07/Oct/24 8:27 AM CEST to 07/Oct/24 8:28 PM CEST, we experienced the error "Something went wrong on our end" for Jira Software and Jira Service Management. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We are investigating issues where the customers faces the error "Something went wrong on our end" and will provide updates here soon. 

The issue occurs specifically with browsers with Ad block and the Brave browser.

components.name: Viewing content

incidents.name: Something went wrong error in Jira

incident_updates.body:
We have identified that the issue is related to a recent update on the Brave browser (https://brave.com/latest/), which is causing some cookie-related problems for users. As a temporary workaround, we recommend using one of our supported browsers: https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/supported-browsers-for-atlassian-cloud-products/.

We understand that many users prefer Brave, and our engineering team will continue to investigate this issue and work towards a resolution on a best-effort basis.
We are investigating an issue with accessing Jira content that is impacting some Jira Cloud customers. We will provide more details within the next hour.

We continue to work on resolving the minor version update issue for Confluence and Jira.

We have identified the root cause and resolved the issue for Connect Jira Apps. 
Minor version updates will be processed over the next 24 hours.

We are working through a fix for Confluence and expect recovery over the coming hours.
We are investigating reports of automatic minor version upgrades for Atlassian Connect not running successfully. We will provide more details once we identify the root cause.

incidents.name: Issue with dev info sync from Bitbucket and GitHub

incident_updates.body: Syncing times for development information have returned to normal - we have scaled up systems to clear the backlog and will continue monitoring

We are aware of delays in syncing development information (from Bitbucket, Github, Gitlab) where information may take up to an hour to appear in Jira.
We are scaling up our services to deal with the load and reduce processing times.
Backfilling for Github (and Bitbucket) are impacted with sync times of up to 20 hours - but new commits, branches, prs should sync within 1 hour.
Development Info takes hours time to sync data from Bitbucket to Jira.

We have identified a fix for the issue and we are working to deploy it to all the affected regions.
We have identified the root cause and we continue to work on resolving the issue affecting the Jira Plans UI.
We are currently experiencing an issue where there is unexpected whitespace on the right side when navigating to Jira Plans.

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved and the service is now operating normally.

Some customers may be experiencing an error showing on the project sidebar, which is impacting their ability to navigate within the project.

incidents.name: Server to Cloud and Cloud to Cloud migrations are not progressing for US-East customers

incident_updates.body: The issue is resolved, customers can now submit new migrations.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Server to Cloud and Cloud to Cloud migrations for Jira for those customers in US East are currently not progressing. Migrations will be stuck at the last task that completed, or it will be showing the migration in the ready state if it has not already started.

We are working on a fix and expect to share an update in approximately 60 minutes. 

Once the issue is resolved, we expect migrations to continue from the point that they were waiting.

Submitting new migrations at this point will queue, so we advise waiting on the original jobs to complete.

We will publish a post-incident review with details of the incident and the actions we are taking to prevent a similar problem in the future.

We are investigating cases of degraded performance on slow workflow provisioning
for some Jira Cloud customers. We have started to investigate the issue and will provide further updates shortly.

incidents.name: Users with Create Issue permission are unable to create tickets

incident_updates.body: The issue causing "You don't have permissions to assign issues" errors for Jira users has been fully resolved. All systems are now operating normally, and users should no longer experience any permission-related problems.

We have identified the issue and applied a potential solution. The change will take approximately four hours to fully roll out, but improvements can be experienced sooner.  We'll share more details in the coming hours.
We are investigating cases of Jira users getting "You don't have permissions to assign issues". We have identified the root cause of the issue. We will provide more details within the next hour.

Earlier today, we experienced issues with Automation. The issue has been resolved for Jira Service Management and Jira, we are working on fixing the issue for Confluence.

incidents.name: Users are experiencing reCaptcha errors while signing up

We have identified the root cause and the issue appears to be resolved.
Users attempting to sign up are encountering reCaptcha errors that are preventing a successful signup.

incidents.name: Replies to JSM and Jira email notifications are creating new Issues instead of adding as Comments

incident_updates.body: Between 10/Sep/24 8:00 PM UTC to 11/Sep/24 11:00 AM UTC, we experienced a service degradation for Jira Service Management and Jira. The issue was related to replies to email being incorrectly treated as a new Ticket/Issue. The incident has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

Between 1.30am IST to 4.30pm IST, replies to Jira and JSM emails were creating duplicate issues/tickets instead of getting added as comments to the original issue/ticket. We have identified the root cause of the intermittent errors and have mitigated the problem. We are now monitoring closely.

We are investigating reports of intermittent errors for some Jira Service Management and Jira Cloud customers where replying to the emails are creating new Issue/Tickets instead of adding replies as comments. We will provide more details once we identify the root cause.

incidents.name: Jira customers won't be able to install apps from pages other than embedded marketplace.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Jira customers won't be able to install apps from pages other than embedded marketplace. Impacted customers are requested to please go to 'apps' menu followed by 'explore more apps' option to go to the embedded marketplace, and from there they can search the app and install it.

incidents.name: Degraded Experience

incident_updates.body:
### SUMMARY

On August 29, 2024, between 8:32 AM and 11:35 AM UTC, Atlassian customers experienced an unexpected disruption in service affecting Jira and Confluence cloud products. This was primarily due to connectivity issues with an external service provider, which impacted our ability to perform certain operations integral to our services. The incident was promptly identified through our monitoring systems, and our teams initiated response protocols to address the issue. The disruption resulted in increased error rates across Jira and Confluence products, temporarily affecting the experience for some of our users.

### **IMPACT**

On August 29, 2024, between 8:32 AM and 11:35 AM UTC, there was an impact on Confluence and Jira cloud affecting customers in multiple regions. The total time to resolution was three hours and three minutes.

### **ROOT CAUSE**

The issue was caused by an outage on our external security token provider. Services which requested security tokens experienced timeouts leading to outages for our cloud products.

Our automated monitoring system detected the incident within one minute and we confirmed the external service outage with the external provider. The provider resolved the outage at 10:02 AM UTC, and full system recovery for Atlassian was completed by 11:35 AM UTC.

### **REMEDIAL ACTIONS PLAN & NEXT STEPS**

We are committed to reducing the risk of similar incidents in the future. To achieve this, we will enhance our system's ability to handle external service disruptions and improve our incident response strategies. Specifically, we will reduce our reliance on single points of failure by setting up fallback region support for the critical security service provider. Additionally, we will implement measures to minimize the recovery time of the Atlassian services once the external security provider has recovered.

Thanks,

Atlassian Customer Support
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We are seeing recovery and monitoring the situation
We are investigating cases of degraded performance and increased error rates for Atlassian products. We will provide more details within the next hour.

incidents.name: Site loading errors for some customers

incident_updates.body: Between 01:00 UTC and 02:00 UTC, some customers experienced issues with site loading for Jira Service Management and Jira. The root cause was related to an RDS saturation. We have deployed a fix to mitigate the issue and verified that the services have recovered. The conditions that caused the bug have been addressed. The issue has been resolved, and the service is operating normally.
We've identified the root cause and resolved it. We're currently monitoring the environment.

incidents.name: View Issue capability impacting some customers

incident_updates.body: Between 04:20 UTC to 07:15 UTC on Aug 27, we experienced an issue in Jira where, upon viewing an issue, an error is shown. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
We've identified an issue in Jira where, upon viewing an issue, an error is shown.

components.name: Viewing content
components.description: Problems viewing issues, dashboards, boards, reports, etc.

incidents.name: Identity is not syncing new user and group information

incident_updates.body: Between 02:35 UTC to 3:55 UTC on Aug 26, we experienced failing Identity sync for Jira Work Management, Jira Service Management, Jira, and Guard. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. All affected Jira customers were synched with Identity and there is not need to wait 24h for a full sync.

The bug has been identified and fixed. However, it could take up to 24 hours since 03:55 UTC for the User and Group reflected correctly.

As a workaround, you may need to perform a new User or Group change.
Between 02:35 UTC and 03:55 UTC, due to bugs in Identity, some changes in users' and group settings were not reflected in Jira.

incidents.name: Display Issue with Design Icons in Jira Board View

incident_updates.body: Between 20 Aug 2024 - 02:08 UTC to 22 Aug 2024 - 16:26 UTC, a minor issue affecting some customer instances resulted in the design icon not displaying within the Jira board view with no impact to functionality. The issue has been resolved and the Jira board view is working normally. If you continue to face any challenges please reach out to us via support ticket.

The root cause has been identified for the display issue of the design icon in the Jira board view. We are currently working on deploying a fix for the issue and will continue to monitor to confirm the behavior has been resolved.

We are investigating an issue with the display of the design icon in the Jira board view that is impacting some Jira Cloud customers. The functionality remains unaffected, and users can still view the design after opening the Jira issue

incidents.name: Atlassian Cloud login is timing out for some customers

incident_updates.body:
### Summary

On August 22, 2024, between 17:04 and 18:55 UTC, Atlassian customers using Jira, Jira Service Management, and Confluence experienced intermittent failures during login. Other affected features that faced intermittent failures are inviting teammates to Jira/Confluence, Jira Service Management helpseeker sign-up using email domain, and creating requests in the Jira portal.

‌

The event was triggered by a faulty database configuration change, which caused approximately 25% of new login attempts to fail. The Automated Monitoring system detected the incident within five minutes and mitigated it by reverting the database configuration, which put Atlassian systems into a known-good state. The total time to resolution was about one hour and 51 minutes.

### **IMPACT**

The overall impact was on August 22 2024, between 17:04 and 18:55 UTC on Jira, Jira Service Management, and Confluence products. The Incident caused service disruption to customers across all regions where the new logins experienced intermittent failures.

### **ROOT CAUSE**

The issue was caused by a faulty database auto-scaling configuration change. As a result, 25% of the new Atlassian login attempts received HTTP 5xx errors.

### **REMEDIAL ACTIONS PLAN & NEXT STEPS**

We know that outages impact your productivity. While we have a number of testing and preventative processes in place, this specific issue wasn’t identified because the change was related to the system's traffic load. The change reduced the database's autoscaling capacity, which was sufficient for low load conditions, but as traffic increased, the capacity was not enough. The automated testing didn’t load the system enough to detect the issue.

We are prioritizing the following improvement actions to avoid repeating this type of incident:

* Streamline the login flow such that inviting teammates or helpseeker sign-ups etc are not part of the main workflow;
* Improve the deployment pipelines such that changes to resources like database can be deployed and tested independent of the code for faster delivery.

Furthermore, we deploy our changes progressively to avoid broad impact. This works well for changes in code, but in this case, the change was to a global resource like database configuration where it gets deployed universally. To minimize the impact of changes to our environments, we will implement additional preventative measures such as:

* Update the testing guidelines so that any database/infrastructure change needs to complete more thorough performance and reliability testing;
* Fix the dashboards for the traffic monitoring such that they show traffic for correct tables and indices.

We apologize to customers whose services were impacted during this incident; we are taking immediate steps to improve the platform’s performance and availability.

Thanks,

Atlassian Customer Support

Between 17:08 UTC and 18:55 UTC, we experienced log-in timing out on some customers for Confluence, Jira Service Management, and Jira. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

We are investigating reports of intermittent login errors to create new sessions for SOME Confluence, Jira Service Management, and Jira Cloud customers. Once we identify the root cause, we will provide more details.
